solution_line_template: {seasons_group1} seasons with {episodes_per_season_group1} episodes had {seasons_group1} x {episodes_per_season_group1} = <<{seasons_group1}*{episodes_per_season_group1}={total_episodes_group1}>>{total_episodes_group1} episodes

{seasons_group2} seasons with {episodes_per_season_group2} episodes had {seasons_group2} x {episodes_per_season_group2} = <<{seasons_group2}*{episodes_per_season_group2}={total_episodes_group2}>>{total_episodes_group2} episodes

All together, there have been {total_episodes_group1} + {total_episodes_group2} + {total_episodes_group3} = <<{total_episodes_group1}+{total_episodes_group2}+{total_episodes_group3}={total_all_episodes}>>{total_all_episodes} episodes.
The average number of episodes a year is {total_all_episodes}/{total_years} = <<{total_all_episodes}/{total_years}={average_episodes_per_year}>>{average_episodes_per_year} episodes
